title: Why does Lucian and Thresh deserve to be in almost every game
body:
Funny thing I keep seeing people saying "but thresh and lucian are skilled champions". Like what is those skills in the first place.

Thresh just runs over anyone with aftershock and Lucian is pretty much Darius without tankiness, but with dashes. A crap ton of dashes and damage.

Both are around 30% pick rate and 51%+ win rate. Like damn. How are these champions not strong when 3/10 of players pick them. Others are considered Op at 10% pick rate and these guys have 3 times over and a high win rate, even higher than it would have been normal at that pick rate.

https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Lucian/
https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/platinum/plus/champion/Thresh/

Thresh Meta is way better than fall asleep on keyboard ardent censor meta. I'm glad supports can actually be proactive and carry/control the botlane instead of just spamming a shield on someone and letting them do all the work. Idk where you get this whole "support players are driven out of the role" idea but I'm pretty sure support players would rather have the chance to make proactive plays instead of afk spamming shields.

>  I'm pretty sure support players would rather have the chance to make proactive plays instead of afk spamming shields.

Yes, which is what made the ward, gold, and item changes years ago so baffling. They quite literally phased out part of the support gameplay, and phased in the kind of gameplay that allows the support to carry/control the botlane. 
Rather than the former macro strategic position of a player who doesn't have to put as much emphasis on the enemies immediately in front of them during the early-mid game (even though in the greater context mid-game has in itself completely changed in parallel).

> I'm glad supports can actually...

Yes, now to all of the supports have had their preferred role stripped from the game to cater to players like yourself who's play style better melds with a position like mid or jungle by virtue of the map design allowing for maximum influence over a single lane without having to be as involved in the laning phase.
Because they are fun and strong.

Thresh: Because he's the fan-favorite. No seriously he's not broken it's just he's the first guy you think of when you think of support. It's kind of like Zed. His playrate right now isn't bad but he's a trash champion and people still pick him because they just want to play him even in ranked. I'd say supports like Zyra are a lot more cancerous than Thresh.

No, his CDR items were almost always Cleaver Essence or just Essence since back then it could give you 30% CDR + either 10% from runes or boots. Essence was and is always bought exactly because it gives CDR albeit the passive synergy with his ult is a nice bonus. Black Cleaver also synergizes with Second Shot since he can proc the armor pen quickly. This is why Lucian does not rely on crit items.

Lucian buys Blade of Ruined Kind not for the lifesteal, but for the passive, which synergizes with second shot because it procs on hit effects doubling BOTRK's passive effectiveness.

Your last sentence proves my point that Lucian was bad under Crit meta since I was arguing that your original claim:

Zed has a decently high playrate for his crazy low winrate and general consensus that he's currently a shit champ. Take a look at Akali as well, high banrate for her okish playrate and low winrate. Pyke, coming in second place for playrate as support, has a 48% winrate. Thresh has a 50.38% Clearly there's more than a champions' viability that's going into champion pickrates. You can't tell me Thresh hasn't been a staple support since his release whether he's op or not. And thresh will continue to have a high playrate regardless of the meta because he's just a well designed champion.

Regarding Lucian, there's a reason the top 3 adcs right now are Lucian, Kaisa, and Ezreal. What do they all have in common? A lack of reliance on Crit items. And considering there's a crit rework coming for this same reason, it's pretty reasonable to say that Lucian thrives in this meta specifically due to the lack of viability of crit items.
